{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3687004,"name":"SndMndBdy","username":"SndMndBdy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-22T14:23:38.300Z","cooked":"

Hi,

My team is considering adding a laser cutter for our workshop. We’re looking at the one that Swyft sells ( 100W 35" x 24" CO2 Laser Cutter (Recommended for FRC Teams) – SWYFT Robotics ). We’d like to cut plywood and SRPP ( MAXComposite Sheets ) with it.

Unfortunately the building that houses our workshop is giving us an awfully hard time about externally venting the smoke and fumes, so that may not be an option. Alternately, has anyone had any success with using an air purifier for a 100W laser like this? Are they effective and safe? Does anyone have any recommended models?

Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-22T14:23:38.300Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":57,"reads":338,"readers_count":337,"score":347.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504521,"topic_slug":"air-purifier-for-laser-cutter","display_username":"SndMndBdy","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://swyftrobotics.com/products/100w-35-x-24-co2-laser-cutter-recommended-for-frc-teams","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"100W 35" x 24" CO2 Laser Cutter (Recommended for FRC Teams) – SWYFT Robotics","clicks":28},{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/MAXComposite-Sheets/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"MAXComposite Sheets","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20008,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/air-purifier-for-laser-cutter/504521/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3687016,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-22T14:28:26.160Z","cooked":"

We run our 40W Epilog (with air-assist) through an air purifier and only exchange air with the classroom. You can get a whiff of smoke while cutting plywood, but I suspect that’s more from what escapes the bed directly rather than bypassing purification. (By this, I mean you can tell the laser is/was in operation, but it’s by no means offensive.)

I would not feel comfortable cutting polycarb with that setup, but cutting wood seems to be OK.

It’s unfortunately summer, so I can’t tell you what model purifier we have.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-22T14:31:42.162Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":327,"readers_count":326,"score":115.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504521,"topic_slug":"air-purifier-for-laser-cutter","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/air-purifier-for-laser-cutter/504521/2","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687017,"name":"Steven Smith","username":"Steven_Smith","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/8e8cbc/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-22T14:34:04.047Z","cooked":"

Not directly answering your question, but does your room have any windows? In our shop, we just took a piece of plywood with a circle cut out for the exhaust vent, and closed the window on the piece of plywood, to give a temporary vent without having to cut a hole in an exterior wall or anything like that. There are probably some purifiers that would work, but nothing as good as just tossing the air outside.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-22T14:34:04.047Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":312,"readers_count":311,"score":62.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504521,"topic_slug":"air-purifier-for-laser-cutter","display_username":"Steven Smith","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20818,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/air-purifier-for-laser-cutter/504521/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687019,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-22T14:50:16.200Z","cooked":"

Please find a way to vent your laser to the outside, via a window or fume hood, for the sake of the health of everyone involved. If you cannot, consider a tool other than a laser.

Combustion products (especially from engineered plastics!) are not good for your lungs. An air purifier cannot remove all of them.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-22T14:52:52.278Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":286,"readers_count":285,"score":402.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504521,"topic_slug":"air-purifier-for-laser-cutter","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":22}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/air-purifier-for-laser-cutter/504521/4","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":19},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":22,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687039,"name":"Cory","username":"Cory","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cory/{size}/312_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-22T16:39:43.333Z","cooked":"

A random air purifier will not work, but there are products sold expressly for the purpose of filtering laser cutter fumes that will enable you to cut with no external exhaust

We have a version of the Atmos for our trotec laser cutter. It works, but I don’t recommend it, if you can at all find a way to exhaust outside, you absolutely should. The total cost of ownership of a laser goes up astronomically once you have filtering involved.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-22T16:39:43.333Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":253,"readers_count":252,"score":275.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504521,"topic_slug":"air-purifier-for-laser-cutter","display_username":"Cory","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.troteclaser.com/en-us/laser-machines/exhaust-systems","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Exhaust systems for laser machines | Trotec Laser","clicks":54}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":13}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":1037,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/air-purifier-for-laser-cutter/504521/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":12},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":13,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687774,"name":"Christine Low","username":"SurfGear","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/surfgear/{size}/120560_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T16:51:05.643Z","cooked":"

We vent to outside, after running it through our custom-build “fume extractor”. High powered fan + multiple filters, flexible ducting.

Cuts down smoke/fumes A LOT, but not 100%.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T16:51:05.643Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":98,"readers_count":97,"score":34.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504521,"topic_slug":"air-purifier-for-laser-cutter","display_username":"Christine Low","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32239,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Bumper Queen"},"post_url":"/t/air-purifier-for-laser-cutter/504521/6","custom_user_title":"Bumper Queen","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3687781,"name":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","username":"RicDV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ricdv/{size}/188502_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T17:03:39.853Z","cooked":"

As a laser engraver…Exhausting outside is the best. Specialized air purifiers cost a bit…however with wood tends to gum up the media used.

Now, you could use a combo of the two to help get up to 100% of the two being used.

I use an inline fan to force the smoke out…I don’t use a filter of any type. It works for both my fiber and CO2.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T17:03:39.853Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":92,"readers_count":91,"score":53.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504521,"topic_slug":"air-purifier-for-laser-cutter","display_username":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 5503"},"post_url":"/t/air-purifier-for-laser-cutter/504521/7","custom_user_title":"Mentor 5503","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3688012,"name":"Adam Bochek","username":"Bochek","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bochek/{size}/2414_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T19:13:49.966Z","cooked":"

We have a BOFA 1500 iQ.

image519×800 39.3 KB

It’s brand new to us so I can’t comment on its performance, but for what its worth the small filter weights about 150lbs.

Yes… we’ve heard the joke

BOFA is a great system. There is also Apple Air (no relations). I can’t comment on it as I don’t own either.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T19:21:25.013Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":70,"readers_count":69,"score":44.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504521,"topic_slug":"air-purifier-for-laser-cutter","display_username":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7271,"username":"Bochek","name":"Adam Bochek","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bochek/{size}/2414_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 5503"},"post_url":"/t/air-purifier-for-laser-cutter/504521/9","custom_user_title":"Mentor 5503","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3688209,"name":"Cory","username":"Cory","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cory/{size}/312_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T23:25:52.188Z","cooked":"
RicDV:

wood tends to gum up the media used.

Yeah this is a key point. If you’re cutting plywood the glue between layers destroys filters. We didn’t know this when we bought our laser and went thru multiple $400+ HEPA filters in a matter of months. Eventually we had to buy a secondary prefilter that injects some fancy powder into the air stream to cause the glue to become less sticky + not pass thru a drum filter, which the prefilter unit periodically cleans with a motorized brush assy. That has worked well, but the unit was very expensive.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-07-23T23:25:52.188Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":51,"readers_count":50,"score":75.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504521,"topic_slug":"air-purifier-for-laser-cutter","display_username":"Cory","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":1037,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/air-purifier-for-laser-cutter/504521/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3688212,"name":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","username":"RicDV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ricdv/{size}/188502_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-23T23:35:56.467Z","cooked":"

I don’t cut wood often…I still have to clean my inline exhaust twice a year…it isn’t that bad…bad enough though.

This is mostly from engraving. Oils and dust collect on the impeller. Fun times!
